text: 84 % of uk mums struck uniforms are ironed , lunchboxes are prepared and bags are packed ; it can mean only one thing -- the first day of term . but it 's not the children dreading the return to the classroom . a new survey revealed that a staggering 84 per cent of mums will be struck by the back-to-school blues this week . a survey reveals that 84 per cent of mothers will be struck by back to school blues this week . according to a nationwide study by butlins the start of september will see 43 per cent feeling sad and lonely , 22 per cent sensing anxiety and one in five -lrb- 20 per cent -rrb- feeling fed up and miserable . with just 12 per cent feeling some sense of relief when the children return to school . while a summer of fun family fixtures has impacted on the number of glum mothers across the uk , a quarter will also be fretting about their children making new friends and enjoying life back in class . and although three quarters of children will expect to feel some level of short-lived anxiety in returning to the school gate , nearly one in five mothers expect to take much longer to get over the start of term . the start of september will see 43 per cent of mothers feeling sad and lonely . and it 's not just mums feeling the strain of september according to the research ; the back-to-school transition is also hard on family pets , with more than 51per cent of owners reporting a change in behaviour of their dogs and cats who have had playful company for six weeks . butlins director of happiness , mark hunter , said : ` while many reports suggest that parents will be glad to see the back of six-weeks of laying on entertainment , our research shows that the summer of 2012 has brought families even closer together , and coming to the end of it is leaving mums feeling really down . ` people can often feel a bit blue after good times , and it 's only when term time resumes that many parents come to the stark realisation that quality family time is really precious . ` now is the time to look ahead and plan things together that they love doing -- whether that 's a weekend trip to the park or a break away . ' in a bid to cure the back-to-school blues , almost half of mums are already researching and booking a half term break to rekindle those special summer moments . almost one in six will hit the shops for a spot of retail therapy , while a quarter will throw themselves into work to take their mind off things . a return to the term time regime . -- uniforms , pe kits , homework squabbles , after-school activity dash and . bedtime tantrums -lrb- 54 % -rrb- . missing quality time spent with the whole family together -lrb- 48 % -rrb- . the end of a summer of day trips -lrb- 39 % -rrb- . the end to a summer spell of spending mealtimes together -lrb- 17 % -rrb- . not having a good excuse to get out of work early -lrb- 10 % -rrb- .
summary: 84 % of uk mums struck by september sadness .   over half of family pets miss the children too .
